snippet: Australian scientists say they have found the world’s oldest sperm, 17 million years old. It’s a rare example of soft tissue being fossilized.
abstract: Dr Renate Matzke-Karasz study in journal Proceedings of the Royal Society B reports discovery of world's oldest sperm in tiny shrimp called ostracods that lived at least 17 million years ago.
lead_paragraph: Australian scientists say they have found the world’s oldest sperm, 17 million years old. It’s a rare example of soft tissue being fossilized.

headline.main: An Ancient Shrimp’s Big Sperm, Preserved
headline.print_headline: Fossils: An Ancient Shrimp’s Big Sperm, Preserved

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: Proceedings of the Royal Society B (Journal)
